page.title: 06Elsenham Railway
page.content: The railway came to Elsenham in 1850. The first station was at Fullers End, then the centre of Elsenham. However, the station was built on an incline and trains stopping at the station could only get started again by being pushed by a second engine. Consequently in 1855 the station was moved a couple of miles outside the village. The village has grown considerably since the station was built and housing has now spread out to the station. The station has two platforms and two lines; an up line to Cambridge and a down line to London. The side line that used to go from Elsenham to Thaxted was closed and its course is now one of the many public footpaths in the area. At the station the line crosses the road and so there is a level crossing with hand operated
